3: Outside the Council Office, Babylonia. 10:54 pm.
Commandant.
My apologies. Did I startle you?
I've been waiting for you, Commandant.
You seemed a little upset during the evening when you had to leave.
I also think our date shouldn't end like that, which is why I want to give it a proper conclusion.
...Commandant.
...I disagree.
Let's go, Commandant. I'll walk you back.

2: I wouldn't want to trouble you!

3: Let's move past the pleasantries.
You're welcome.
Silence fills the air at once. All you can hear is the sound of your overlapping footsteps.
I had a good time today—

2: Did you have a good time today—

4: What were you trying to say?

3: ...I had a great time today.
Going to gatherings with you, cooking for you, and watching a movie with you has made me very happy.
Perhaps my usual sternness has not made me very popular.

2: That's not true. That's what made you Bianca.
4: No way, Bianca. You're first on the Date-a-Construct chart!

3: But it troubles me sometimes as well.
...What is that?
Anyway, it troubles me sometimes as well.
Why would I have conflicting thoughts when I claim to abide by my faith...?

2: There's nothing wrong with your faith.
Your faith creates the very foundation of who you are.
And those conflicts... smooth out the edges.

3: ...Do you really believe that, Commandant?

2: Of course. When have I ever lied to you?

3: You're right. I've chosen this path, and I will see it through.
I will sacrifice everything for what I believe to be 'right' until the day the Punishing Virus vanishes from this Earth.
Commandant... why do you think I'm determined?
Everyone else thinks I'm stubborn.
Commandant... why do you think I'm kind?
Everyone else thinks I'm cruel.

2: Why do you act so prudent on your missions, Bianca?
4: Why did you join the Purifying Force, Bianca?

3: It's illogical to carry out purification when I have not confirmed the risks the targets pose with my own investigations.
Those infected Constructs... are in such unimaginable pain that someone has to free them from their torments.
Commandant...

2: I had a lovely time today.
4: I'm glad I could go on a date with you.

3: ...Me too.
Me too.

2: You know? You don't have to envy me at all.

3: Hmm? Why?

2: Because you're one of us, duh.

3: We've arrived, Commandant.

4: Can't believe a lady walked me home!

3: Then, I think this concludes our date. Properly.
I'll see you again, Gray Raven Commandant.
